channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: LinkedIn’s Aneesh Raman says the career ladder is disappearing in the AI era
item.description: As AI evolves, the world of work is getting even better for the most creative, curious, and growth-minded employees. So says Aneesh Raman, LinkedIn’s ...

item.title: Canva skills are what people hiring graphic designers increasingly want to see
item.description: For our 2025 Where the Design Jobs Are report , Fast Company looked at which design tools were being mentioned in job listings across various discipli...

item.title: US-Japan trade deal gives Trump control over $550 billion in investments. It could be ‘vapor ware’ — and a model for other countries
item.description: Analysts at Bank of America said that the Japan deal "looks like a reasonable blueprint" for other auto-exporting countries like South Korea.

item.title: Master the 3-2-1 Rule on LinkedIn to Quickly Build Your Personal Brand
item.description: This simple rule makes it easy to transform your posting strategy from scattered thoughts into purposeful content.

item.title: 12 signs you’re micromanaging without realizing it
item.description: Micromanagement can silently creep into leadership styles, often without conscious awareness. Could you be micromanaging without knowing it? Here, lea...

item.title: How Defining Your Fear Helps You Prioritize Tasks With Confidence
item.description: Even the savviest entrepreneurs struggle with prioritization skills. Face your fears by first defining them.

item.title: The Invisible Weight Slowing Down Every Leader
item.description: Unmade decisions silently drain your energy, clarity, and momentum.

item.title: US health, tech officials to launch data-sharing plan
item.description: HHS Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and CMS Administrator Mehmet Oz are expected to host executives at an event on Wednesday.

item.title: The Tea app was intended to help women date safely. Then hackers leaked 72,000 images online, including users’ selfies
item.description: No email addresses or phone numbers were exposed, the company said, and the breach only affects users who signed up before February 2024.

item.title: Here’s how the Federal Reserve funds itself, including renovations, without taxpayer dollars
item.description: Unlike the Pentagon and a new weapons system that has blown through its budget, the Fed and its operations are funded differently.

item.title: Beef costs, burrito blues, and boarding groups: The business stories everyone’s talking about this week

item.title: Allianz Life says hackers accessed personal data on the majority of its 1.4 million US customers
item.description: Allianz Life said the data breach happened on July 16 when a “malicious threat actor” accesses a third-party, cloud-based system used by the company.

item.title: How to Handle a Firestorm Sparked by a Leader’s Missteps
item.description: A public scandal isn’t just a PR nightmare. It’s a test of strategic foresight.

item.title: How to Transform Onboarding Into a Meaningful Process That Makes New Hires Feel Appreciated
item.description: Most onboarding processes were designed to benefit the employer far more than the employee.
